$comment: Please do not edit this schema by hand. Generate it instead by running npm run build:schema.

RS01.event.title: RS01.event
RS01.event.description: An attention or audio event generated by RS01

eventType.description: the type of event this object represents

pageId.description: each page ID is 128-bit value, randomly generated with the Web Crypto API and stored as a hexadecimal `String`. While this representation is less efficient than a `Uint8Array` or similar, it is more convenient for development and debugging. The page ID is available in the content script environment.

url.description: the URL associated with the page visit

referrer.description: the referrer URL for the page loading in the tab

pageVisitStartTime.description: a unix timestamp in miliseconds specifying the start time of the page visit

pageVisitStopTime.description: a unix timestamp in miliseconds specifying the start time of the page visit. NOTE: this field will not necessarily represent the page visit stop time, just the largest time value at the time of the event creation. For a given page id, look for the largest value of pageVisitStopTime to get more accurate information.

duration.description: duration of the event in miliseconds

eventStartTime.description: a unix timestamp in miliseconds specifying the start time of the event

eventStopTime.description: a unix timestamp in miliseconds specifying the stop time of the event

title.description: the contents of the title element in the head of the page

description.description: the og:description meta tag contents. If this isn't supplied, then attempts to look at the meta description

maxPixelScrollDepth.description: the largest scroll pixel depth reached on the page

maxRelativeScrollDepth.description: the largest depth reach on the page, as a proportion of the total page height

scrollHeight.description: the total scroll height of the page, taken from document.documentElement.scrollHeight
